s.text: Warm praise was bestowed by the left-leaning Paris newspaper LibŽration on the often derided paintings by Sir Winston Churchill, of which the auction house Sotheby's staged an exhibition in London this week.

The word "Enough," splashed across the front page of the Algerian government newspaper El Moudjahid , referred not, as one might have expected, to the continuing massacres by Islamic extremists, which are reported to have claimed at least 600 dead since the holy month of Ramadan began Dec. 30, but to the agitation the killings have provoked in western Europe and the United States.

Across the English Channel, the influential Le Monde said that nothing seemed able to stop "the financial torment of Asia," which was now poised to claim China as its next victim unless there was a "rapid and collective reaction" by the international community.
